description: ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION TO PROVIDE AN ADDITIONAL TWO BEDROOM DWELLING.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials to be used for the external surfaces of the building/extension hereby approved shall be those specified in the approved planning application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 3 - Details of those parts of the site not covered by buildings including any parking, service roads, sight lines, footpaths, hard and soft landscaping, surface treatment and boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any development hereby permitted commences. These works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until a scheme for the storage of refuse and recycling has
been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme as
approved shall be carried out in full prior to the first occupation of the development and shall
thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and
recycling material and to comply with policies BE.15 and PE.11 of the Adopted Merton
Unitary Development Plan 2003.

Condition : 6 - The development shall not commence until details of measures to achieve a 20% reduction in
carbon dioxide emissions from the use of on-site renewable energy sources, including
measures to monitor renewable energy production (which must be compatible with the
London Borough of Merton�s energy data-gauge system � details at www.energence.co.uk)
have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority (the baseline
for such calculations being the current Building Regulations at the date of this permission
plus the CO2 emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by the Building
Regulations). The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved
measures, which shall be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the development supports the Mayor�s Climate Change Mitigation
and Energy Strategy and to meet the objectives of policy 4A.7 of the Adopted London Plan
2008.

Condition : 7 - The new dwelling unit/s shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards.

Reason: To meet the changing needs of households and comply with policies HN.3 of the
Adopted Merton Unitary Development Plan 2003 and 3A.5 of the London Plan February
2008.

Condition : 8 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, no part of the
development hereby approved shall be occupied until a Building Research
Final Code Certificate confirming that it has achieved not less than a Code 3 level for
Sustainable Homes has been submitted to, and acknowledged in writing by the Local
Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the development achieves a high standard of sustainability and
makes efficient use of resources and to comply with policies BE.25 of the Adopted Merton
Unitary Development Plan 2003 and 4A.3 of the Adopted London Plan 2008.

Condition : 9 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The proposals would contribute to meeting the Council's housing targets. The extension is of a satisfactory design and would provide a suitable standard of accommodation for future occupiers. The proposals would not impact on the amenity of surrounding residents. The proposal  accords with the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan and London Plan Policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal.

Merton Unitary Development Plan (October 2003) 
HP.1: Housing Target
HS.1: Housing Layout and Amenity
PK.2: Car Parking Standards
PK.3: Car Parking and Development
BE.23: Alterations and Extensions to Buildings

London Plan (2008)
3A.1 (Increasing London�s supply of housing),
3A.2 (Borough housing targets),
3A.3 (Maximising the potential of sites)
4B.1 (Design Principles for a Compact City)
4A.7 (Renewable energy).
4A.3 (Sustainable design and construction)

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE: You are advised of the necessity to consult the Council's Highways team prior to the commencement of construction in order to obtain necessary approvals and licences prior to undertaking any works within the Public Highway including Scaffolding, Temporary/Permanent Crossovers, Oversailing/Undersailing of the Highway, Drainage/Sewer Connections, Hoarding, Excavations (including excavations adjacent to the highway such as basements, etc), Temporary Full/Part Road Closures, Craneage Licences etc.

Condition : 11 - INFORMATIVE:  The Council's Street Naming and Numbering team (at street.naming@merton.gov.uk or on 0208 545 3507) must be notified if the development hereby permitted involves the construction of a property that will require a number (please contact 3 months before completion) or a street name (please contact 6 months before completion).
